deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Bid can not be more than item's price"

arguments.value: Bid can not be more than item's price

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Bid can not be more than item's price"

documentation.text:
Ensure that `msg.value` is an even number.
 Division will truncate if it is an odd number.
 Check via multiplication that it wasn't an odd number

Start of BlindAuction
 In a real world scenario this function should
 call only the bid function because the nakedBids
 should have been an external input from another
 contract or application.

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => struct eShop.Bid storage ref[] storage ref)
struct eShop.Bid storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text:
Place a blinded bid with `_blindedBid` =
 keccak256(abi.encodePacked(value, fake, secret)).
 The sent ether is only refunded if the bid is correctly
 revealed in the revealing phase. The bid is valid if the
 ether sent together with the bid is at least "value" and
 "fake" is not true. Setting "fake" to true and sending
 not the exact amount are ways to hide the real bid but
 still make the required deposit. The same address can
 place multiple bids.

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => struct eShop.SecretBids storage ref[] storage ref)

struct eShop.Bid storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text:
Secret is just the required string for the matching encoding.
 Reveal your blinded bids. You will get a refund for all
 correctly blinded invalid bids and for all bids except for
 the totally highest.
Withdraw a bid that was overbid.

End the auction and send the highest bid
 to the beneficiary.

documentation.text:
The main function responsible for revealing
 the bids. In a real world scenario this
 function should be a separate contract or
 app, because this contract simulates an
 external input.

This is an "internal" function which means that it
 can only be called from the contract itself (or from
 derived contracts).

attributes.text:
Ensure that `msg.value` is an even number.
 Division will truncate if it is an odd number.
 Check via multiplication that it wasn't an odd number

Start of BlindAuction
 In a real world scenario this function should
 call only the bid function because the nakedBids
 should have been an external input from another
 contract or application.

Place a blinded bid with `_blindedBid` =
 keccak256(abi.encodePacked(value, fake, secret)).
 The sent ether is only refunded if the bid is correctly
 revealed in the revealing phase. The bid is valid if the
 ether sent together with the bid is at least "value" and
 "fake" is not true. Setting "fake" to true and sending
 not the exact amount are ways to hide the real bid but
 still make the required deposit. The same address can
 place multiple bids.

attributes.text:
This is an "internal" function which means that it
 can only be called from the contract itself (or from
 derived contracts).

auctionEnd(uint256).notice: End the auction and send the highest bid to the beneficiary.

bid(bytes32,uint256).notice: Place a blinded bid with `_blindedBid` = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(value, fake, secret)). The sent ether is only refunded if the bid is correctly revealed in the revealing phase. The bid is valid if the ether sent together with the bid is at least "value" and "fake" is not true. Setting "fake" to true and sending not the exact amount are ways to hide the real bid but still make the required deposit. The same address can place multiple bids.

checkBidding(uint256,bytes32,uint256,boo.notice: Start of BlindAuction In a real world scenario this function should call only the bid function because the nakedBids should have been an external input from another contract or application.

constructor.notice: Ensure that `msg.value` is an even number. Division will truncate if it is an odd number. Check via multiplication that it wasn't an odd number

reveal(uint256).notice: The main function responsible for revealing the bids. In a real world scenario this function should be a separate contract or app, because this contract simulates an external input.

revealInternal(uint256[],bool[],string[].notice: Secret is just the required string for the matching encoding. Reveal your blinded bids. You will get a refund for all correctly blinded invalid bids and for all bids except for the totally highest.

withdraw(uint256).notice: Withdraw a bid that was overbid.
